column4: hi is there a way to install ubuntu with a kernel, that doesnt require a pae cpu?
umm what pae is for memory has nothing to do with cpu

but this time i tend to believe it, I tried ubuntu 8.10 9.04 mythdora 10 and centos 5.2 and they always reboot about 1 second after starting, noapic and acpi=off can stretch that a little, like 2 seconds, I once ran openfiler on it (2 years ago) I think it used a 2.4... kernel, which is said, not to support pae
